item.name: Infinity Gauntlet: A Love Letter Game

play.comments: Rob's game
Still playing 2 week later. Took 2+ hours to setup and now 6 hours into the game. Postponed playing last week (after two weeks). Finished on 5/27/21
Added Rob and Meredith to the game Zack and I started last week. Still not complete but at moving along. Complicated at times but fun.
Zack's game, neat how you triangulate your questions
Meredith's game, with Meeples!
Zack's game
Very long setup and learning. Only played 2 rounds
first time
6 players, eastern and western us on custom neoprene map (Russ) at Maine wargamers meeting
Played a variant by Rick Barber (?) on a redrawn (hand drawn) map. Mde it to Robert E. Lee's arrival on Day 1.
Pioneers won twice.
I really don't like the swap with player on your right trap. Got hit by it twice!
All wins.
On back of carrom board. All wins

First time play. I like the concept of personal vs corporate and the indirect actions you as a player take then the actions the corporations take. And the ability to invest in other corporations run by other players. While there were periods of downtime as other players sorted out actions, and the sorting out of your own actions can sometimes take a bit of time to get right. Would definitely play again!
first play; made it to 4th level and ran out of time. second play; made it to 5th level and ran out of cards.
Stopped at about 6.5 hours
2nd place, not bad for a first play. Fun, quick, easy.
Win, longest train all but one of my trains was consecutive.
Did not finish, iPad died.
We lost by one card

item.name: One Deck Dungeon: Forest of Shadows

play.comments: Difficult to understand the rule book. Tried and failed to play the original last weekend. Did a bit better this time, though still not sure we did it right. Very confusing at times but fun rolling piles of dice.
Fun theme, though "sky bridge" should be "bunny burrow." Interesting game play with two players, swapping hands. Reminded me of 7 Wonders.
Played in Rivals of Ixalan pre-release event. Played 3; won 2 lost 1
Shawn liked it so much we played again!
Played in Plansewalker league
It got late, we couldn't understand the directions and gave up after trying a few turns.
Fun game, easy to understand, hard to strategize! Quick and easy rules and the cards tell you all you need to know

item.name: Discoveries: The Journals of Lewis & Clark

play.comments:
The game mechanics were, at first, tricky, but more fluid and enjoyable as the game got moving. The theme, Lewis and Clark, did not feel like an integral part of the game but more of a layer on top of the mechanics.
Having only played once, not sure if there are multiple strategies that can win, e.g. would collecting tipis or sets of cards generate a win without also taking a large number of paths (for points).
A fun game for the family on a Friday evening. The tokens were a bit hard to make out at times, which made counting, placement, and conquering confusing. Three out of four of us would play it again.

Just as good as the original ticket to ride. This was especially fun to play as we just returned from Europe. Thigh, many of the city names were still foreign to us. The new tunnels, ferries, and train stations added some depth and complexity that may have been difficult if we had not played the original version and understood the mechanics already. Four out of four would play it again, and again.
